content:
I was thinking if we can add chevron-down to more topic
Screenshot-from-2020-05-01-09-40-26.png
does this look good?

I guess this icon may create confusion about the behavior here. Chevon generally indicates a dropdown menu/list but here, on clicking more topics, it does not show that behavior and opens a list of topics.

It indicate something is gonna expand...here it is topic list
If you noticed windows side navigations it uses chevron for this behaviour...not exactly like this but something sort of this
Screenshot-6.png

Or we can use right side pointed type of chevron
We have the opposite one to go back to ALL STREAMS
Screenshot-from-2020-05-01-11-07-58.png
It will more continuous, I guess

It indicate something is gonna expand...here it is topic list

Yeah but the title and other things(other titles, styles, etc.) remain at the same place and the list just expands. Here the whole list is changing so I am not much sure about using it.

Screenshot-from-2020-05-01-11-09-59.png
Help centre also uses chevron for list expansion

I don't think the chevron fits the more topics. It's not an item that folds out, but it gets replaced by the topics.

But are we talking about all the time, or on hover (like the stream/topic dots)?
I don't think so making title static changes nature of chevron or its use case

Using some sort of arrow with more topics just makes it different from stream topics and helps in defining more explicitly its click behaviour(although we have a different font, but that's a very minute difference)
Or maybe it's just me :grimacing:
I agree, I don't think chevron works for "more topics". I think we can make it different with other styling approaches.
(There's ideas like ... that are plausible, I think)
I suggested a change in > "more topics" that I think would be sufficient to achieve the goals here?

@Yash RE âœ¨ I would try looking at that design in the case where there's an unread count on "more topics" -- I think it might look odd? That's certainly a design consideration I'd have in thinking about centering the widget.

Yeah... centered text + right aligned unread is not too great:
image.png

neither is centered (text + unread):
image.png

but there's also right aligned (text + unread) which is a little better imo:
image.png

I think the left-aligned-with-different-font looks more natural than any of those. I think we should explore more options for how to make the "more topics" font different -- e.g. we could perhaps use a different text color like the "you" in the right sidebar.

That's fair and probably the best place to explore.

There's also the idea of adding a permanent background (not sure if it's good, just wanted to mention it)
image.png
Yeah, I think that will be confusing given that we use a background to highlight which view you're looking at.

And highlighting would force the user's attention to that element, which isn't something we want; we're looking for it to be easily visually filtered if you're looking at the topics in view, not for it to jump out at you.
